subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Siddhartha's Great Awakening
description: Learn Siddhartha's Great Awakening in one minute.

hook.text: A prince gave up his throne to sit under a tree. What he found there started a religion with 500 million followers.

buildup.text: Siddhartha Gautama was a sheltered Indian prince. One day he saw sickness, old age, and death for the first time.

discovery.text: Horrified, he left his palace to find the cause of suffering. After years of searching, he meditated under a Bodhi tree.

twist.text: He achieved enlightenment â€” understanding that suffering comes from attachment. He became the Buddha: 'awakened one.'

climax.text: Buddha didn't claim to be a god. He said he found a path anyone could walk. That accessibility changed everything.

punchline.text: A prince found that suffering comes from attachment. Buddhism was born.

quiz.question: What did the Buddha discover was the cause of suffering?
